summary: The Information and Communications Technology and Services National Security Review Act establishes an Office of Information and Communications Technology and Services (OICTS) within the Department of Commerce. This office is tasked with reviewing and mitigating national security risks associated with certain ICTS transactions, particularly those involving entities and jurisdictions of concern (e.g., China, Russia). The bill grants the Secretary of Commerce broad powers to investigate, regulate, and prohibit transactions that pose undue risk to U.S. national security, critical infrastructure, or the digital economy. It also includes provisions for risk assessments by the Director of National Intelligence, and establishes an ICTS technical advisory committee..
